alert.note: Alert for Fillmore; Nuckolls (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 18 at 3:25AM CST until January 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of two tenths to three tenths of an inch. Winds will average 15 to 25 MPH with highest gusts of 30 to 35 MPH, initially out of the northeast but then turning northwesterly Wednesday night. This will end up being more of an ice event in the Fillmore and Nuckolls County area. * WHERE...Fillmore and Nuckolls Counties * WHEN...From midnight Tuesday night to midnight CST Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult in the warned area due to the combination of freezing rain and snow. The hazardous conditions will develop in time to impact the morning commute and continue through the evening commute. Lingering impacts into at least Thursday morning are likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While minor forecast adjustments remain possible, forecast confidence has increased enough that significant snow accumulation will indeed occur.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
